image.altText: A screenshot of a video showing a man with mud on his face.

props.synopsis: The federal government was alerted to the disappearance of Oscar Jenkins in Ukraine weeks before a hostage video emerged.

title.children: DFAT knew captured Australian was 'missing' for weeks in Ukraine

image.altText: Sheep graze in a dusty paddock while a huge plume of smoke rises from the mountains behind them.

props.synopsis: Temperatures are forecast to reach the mid-40s across Victoria on Boxing Day, with fire conditions in the state expected to mirror those of the 2019/20 bushfires.

title.children: Total fire ban issued for Victoria ahead of expected Boxing Day blazes

image.altText: A town built on a hill, surrounded by a fence. On the other side of the fence is greenery

props.synopsis: The future of the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights has become a hot topic of debate, after the Israel Defense Forces pushed troops and tanks over the border into Syrian territory.

title.children: Along 'the shouting fence', locals fear Israeli plans after Assad's fall

image.altText: A woman in a blue dress accepts a figurine as men watch on

props.synopsis: Russia denies Turkish media reports suggesting the British-born wife of former Syrian president Basher al-Assad has filed for a divorce.

title.children: Kremlin rejects divorce claims about Asma al-Assad

image.altText: Australian money

props.synopsis: A weak Chinese economy, American threats to impose punishing trade tariffs, a poor medium-to-longer-term outlook for our key exports and a sluggish economy are likely to keep the Australian dollar under pressure through 2025, threatening to send it to 20-year lows.

title.children: The Aussie dollar could plunge to 20-year low

image.altText: Donald Trump in front of a wall of American flags.

props.synopsis: Greenland tells Donald Trump the country is not for sale, responding to the US president-elect's comments about taking control of the territory.

title.children: Greenland says it is not for sale, after Trump suggests taking control

image.altText: A woman with beige headphones and a tote bag walks past a shop window advertising 50 per cent off.

props.synopsis: Retailers expect shoppers to splurge almost $1.3 billion on Boxing Day itself and $24.7 billion for the entire sales period, which is set to be the biggest on record.

title.children: Boxing Day sales to be the biggest on record despite cost of living pressures

image.altText: A picture of the IMF headquarters

props.synopsis: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) warns the Reserve Bank to consider tighter monetary policy if progress on lowering inflation stalls.

title.children: IMF warns RBA should consider rate hikes ahead of government spending spree

image.altText: Matt Gaetz stands at a podium and speaks.

props.synopsis: An investigation has uncovered "substantial evidence" that former congressman Matt Gaetz, who Donald Trump had hoped to make US attorney-general, paid for sex with a 17-year-old girl.

title.children: Matt Gaetz paid for sex, including with 17yo, ethics report alleges

image.altText: A man wearing a black shirt and a traditional Tongan woven mat.

props.synopsis: Tonga's parliament elects former finance minister 'Aisake Eke as its new prime minister in a Christmas Eve sitting.

title.children: New Tongan PM elected in secret ballot after surprise resignation

image.altText: LawConnect owner and skipper Christian Beck speaks to the media

props.synopsis: The Sydney to Hobart fleet is bracing for a fast start, a wild first night at sea and the high chance of boats ending up damaged.

title.children: Weather concerns Sydney to Hobart captains, but race record is in sight

image.altText: Tsunami monitoring buoy

props.synopsis: Authorities believe the nation is now "much better prepared" to deal with a tsunami than it was two decades ago, but community awareness is low.

title.children: Fears Australians don't understand dangers of tsunamis as risk persists

props.synopsis:
Turkish authorities say they’ve seized a baby gorilla after an attempt to smuggle it through the country from Nigeria, en-route to Thailand.

It was seized over the weekend after customs officials inspected a crate, handing it over to the national parks authority, which says the baby gorilla’s health is improving after treatment.

title.children: Authorities seize baby gorilla attempted to be smuggled through Türkiye

image.altText: Cadbury was first awarded a Royal Warrant in 1854.

props.synopsis: King Charles grants royal warrants to 386 companies that previously held warrants from the late Queen, including Weetabix, Heinz and Nestle. Here's what it means.

title.children: Cadbury chocolate stripped of royal warrant after 170 years

image.altText: Alex de Minaur of Australia and Katie Boulter of Great Britain during the Mixed Doubles second-round match during Wimbledon

props.synopsis: Ahead of the "extremely important" United Cup tournament, Australia's top-ranked men's tennis player Alex de Minaur announces his engagement with English tennis star Katie Boutler.

title.children: Alex de Minaur and Katie Boulter announce engagement before United Cup meeting

image.altText: Men holding boxes

props.synopsis: Closures in the Kurram district in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province have paralysed medical facilities, leaving hundreds of thousands stranded without essential supplies, including sick kids.

title.children: Blockade in north-west Pakistan leaves 31 kids dead, doctors allege

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: The tribunal heard that any industrial action in place on New Year's Eve will not disrupt train services or impede passengers' ability to travel to and from the city.

title.children: NSW government, rail unions reach resolution ahead of NYE fireworks

image.altText: A tall eucalyptus tree at night covered in fairy lights and a star made of lights at the top.

props.synopsis: When an 80-metre gum tree in the Tasmanian forest was due to be cut down for logging, conservationists turned it into the world's tallest Christmas tree.

title.children: The world's tallest Christmas tree still stands today thanks to activists decorating it 25 years ago

image.altText: close up of man with dark brown hair wearing brown jumper

props.synopsis: The alleged killer of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson has pleaded not guilty to state murder and terror charges in a New York court.

title.children: Luigi Mangione pleads not guilty to murdering health insurance CEO

image.altText: Ismail Haniyeh puts his right index finger across his stubbled chin as he tilts his head down slightly and looks forwards.

props.synopsis: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz has admitted for the first time publicly to Israel's killing of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh.

title.children: Israel confirms it killed Hamas's top political leader in Iran

image.altText: A photo of a computer screen video that says "dinosaur dreaming" and pictures a man smiling.

props.synopsis: Western Australian Museum has been forced to remove a video from one of its popular exhibits after the ABC highlighted the man in it was a convicted sex offender.

title.children: WA Museum removes exhibit video featuring convicted Broome sex offender

image.altText: A dark blue logo with white text saying "cryptoloc".

props.synopsis: A business shutting down its key operations raises questions about the future rollout of a contract with the Queensland government to help boost cybersecurity for small businesses.

title.children: Cybersecurity business shuts key operation after winning $15m state government contract

props.synopsis: The first captive-born Maugean skate in the world turns one year old on Christmas Eve, in a milestone for the Tasmanian breeding program.

title.children: Captive-bred endangered skate celebrates first birthday with dog toy

image.altText: Woman wearing cap and bee suit holding bee smoker at coastal apriary

props.synopsis: The NSW south coast's only queen bee breeder is using artificial insemination to breed honey bee colonies that are resistant to varroa mite.

title.children: Beekeeper working to crack genetic code that could help manage varroa mite pest

image.altText: Boat surrounded by sharks in blue ocean

props.synopsis: Two mates launched a drone to get a better view of their boat only to find themselves surrounded by more than a dozen sharks. A marine biologist suggests their engine noise was the main attraction.

title.children: Dramatic drone footage shows fishermen's tinnie surrounded by sharks

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of South Australia.

props.synopsis: A court has ruled the body of a teenager — whose death is being investigated as murder — be cremated against his mother's wishes.

title.children: Court orders murdered teenager be cremated against his mother's wishes

image.altText: A sign on a fence says 'asbestos'.

props.synopsis: The state's environmental watchdog has charged three companies and one individual with 102 alleged offences related to 26 sites that contained mulch contaminated with asbestos.

title.children: EPA begins prosecutions over asbestos mulch discovery across NSW

image.altText: A man holds a bright lobster close to the camera.

props.synopsis: Australians are snapping up lobsters for Christmas feasts, shrugging off price increases. But this year might be their last chance to score a good deal.

title.children: Lobsters in demand this Christmas, but prices could soon change

image.altText: Large fillets of fish on chopping boards.

props.synopsis: Many Australians wouldn't think of eating the carp they catch, but for the Eastern European communities, the bony fish is an important part of Christmas customs.

title.children: Carp's a great catch for traditional Czech-Australian Christmas

image.altText: Food on a table for a Christmas meal.

props.synopsis: From meal preparation to the conversation over lunch, couples and relationships counsellor Kris Waller says a calm and fun Christmas Day starts with relinquishing any fantasies of perfection.

title.children: Relationship counsellor shares advice for an enjoyable Christmas Day

image.altText: Sam Konstas smiles while speaking to media at an Australian training session

props.synopsis: Teenage opener Sam Konstas will become one of Australia's youngest Test cricketers after being named to make his debut at the MCG on Boxing Day.

title.children: Sam Konstas to debut in Boxing Day Test, Travis Head battles calf strain

image.altText: The patchy outfield at Docklands

props.synopsis: Docklands' patchy outfield and difficult batting wicket could prompt Cricket Australia to stop scheduling BBL matches there until closer to January.

title.children: Patchy Docklands surface looks bad as Big Bash considers avoiding venue

image.altText: a woman with her back to camera, she is staring off to the left, there is a pelican in front of her, ocean in background

props.synopsis: There has been a spike in pelicans with suspected botulism dying on the NSW Central Coast in recent weeks. But the symptoms are similar to a highly contagious strain of bird flu not yet detected in Australia.

title.children: Surveillance efforts increase amid concerns marine bird illness could be masking bird flu

image.altText: A woman in a dress talks to a tall man in a suit.

props.synopsis: When Carol O'Connor escaped an abusive relationship she sought solace in her art, not knowing she would one day paint for a prince.

title.children: Prince Philip helped save an Australian bird from extinction that Carol painted for him

image.altText: A claymation man, gnome and dog stand outside in front of a large wooden box.

props.synopsis: We first met evil penguin Feathers McGraw in 1993's The Wrong Trousers. Now he's back, seeking revenge on Wallace & Gromit through the spectre of AI.

title.children: The new Wallace & Gromit film gives Mission: Impossible a run for its money
